Robert Sayre wrote:
> >  However the parser matters a great deal. Of course you can use a real
> >  parser on JSON, but many programs don't. That JSON can be and is treated
> >  as executable code is a major flaw in its design, one XML doesn't share.
> 
> XML is treated as executable code all the time.

Certainly XSLT is. And arguably Ant buildfiles, although I haven't seen
many of those used as components in webtwenny mashups.
-- 
Chris Burdess
